blocks.name: ltso
blocks.content: 'Less than' is a strict ordering. (Contributed by NM, 19-Jan-1997.)
blocks.origin:
thm ltso() {
  |- wor(clt, cr)
} = {
  isso2i(hs0, hs1, hs2, clt, cr)
  axlttri(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  lttr(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), cv(hs2))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(clt)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs1.c(clt)
  diff.hs1.c(cr)
  diff.hs2.c(clt)
  diff.hs2.c(cr)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ltso() {
  ⊢ < ≺ ℝ
} = {
  isso2i(hs0, hs1, hs2, clt, cr)
  axlttri(hs0, hs1)
  lttr(hs0, hs1, hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(clt)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs1.c(clt)
  diff.hs1.c(cr)
  diff.hs2.c(clt)
  diff.hs2.c(cr)
}

thm eqlei2(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 = c1 → c0[≤]c1)
  ⊣ c1 ∈ ℝ
} = {
  mpcom(c0 = c1, c0[≤]c1, c0 ∈ ℝ)

blocks.name: dedekindle
blocks.content: The Dedekind cut theorem, with the hypothesis weakened to only require non-strict less than. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 2-Jul-2013.)
